intro: Mallostoma shannonii, commonly known as Shannon's mallostoma, is a rare flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, sandy soils in forested areas. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is protected in several states.
